intro: Fintelmannia microstachya, commonly known as the small-stalked fintelmannia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to parts of Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant features small, clustered yellow flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Fintelmannia microstachya is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, well-drained soils.
